description: The MSA segment contains information sent while acknowledging another message.

1.name: Acknowledgement Code
1.description: This field contains an acknowledgment code, see message processing rules. Refer to HL7 table 0008 - Acknowledgment code for valid values.
1.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

2.name: Message Control ID
2.description: This field contains the message control ID of the message sent by the sending system. It allows the sending system to associate this response with the message for which it is intended.

3.name: Text Message
3.description: This optional field further describes an error condition. This text may be printed in error logs or presented to an end user.

4.name: Expected Sequence Number
4.description: This optional numeric field is used in the sequence number protocol.

5.name: Delayed Acknowledgment Type
5.description: This field has been retained for backward compatibility. This field is used only as described above, in Section 2.12.2, 'Application (level 7) processing rules, deferred processing two phase reply (original acknowledgment mode only).' Otherwise this field is not used.
5.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

6.name: Error Condition
6.description: This field allows the acknowledging system to use a user-defined error code to further specify AR or AE type acknowledgments. This field is a generalized replacement for MSA-3-text message.
